Package camzup.core

Class Simplex

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Simplex
public abstract class Simplex
extends java.lang.Object
A simplex noise class created with reference to "Simplex noise demystified" by Stefan Gustavson. Hashing functions are based on Bob Jenkins lookup3 script, http://burtleburtle.net/bob/c/lookup3.c. Flow implementations written with reference to Simon Geilfus's library, which in turn references the work of Robert Bridson.

This class uses the following variations:
  • stores stretch constants multiplied by their coefficients in constants (e.g., G2_2);
  • sets a DEFAULT_SEED to the current time in milliseconds;
  • does not combine scalars with derivatives into a vector one dimension higher than the input (output parameters are used instead);
  • initializes mutable integer offsets i, j, k to zero, then changes them only if appropriate conditions are met;
  • changes where n and t factors are multiplied in evaluate function so that a calculation does not need to be redone for derivatives;
  • attempts to match the offset step in noise functions to the magnitude of the input vector rather than using an arbitrary one (123.456, etc.).
Most simplex functions scale the sum of noise contributions by a magic number to bring it into range. There is little explanation for how these numbers are arrived at. Although the range is expected to be within [-1.0, 1.0], it is not guaranteed.
Author:
Robert Bridson, Simon Geilfus, Stefan Gustavson, Bob Jenkins

    • fbm

      public static float fbm​(Vec2 v, int seed, int octaves, float lacunarity, float gain)
      Fractal Brownian Motion. For a given number of octaves, sums the output value of a noise function. Per each iteration, the output is multiplied by the amplitude; amplitude is multiplied by gain; frequency is multiplied by lacunarity.
      Parameters:
      v - the input coordinate
      seed - the seed
      octaves - the number of iterations
      lacunarity - the lacunarity
      gain - the gain
      Returns:
      the result

    • fbm

      Parameters:
      v - the input coordinate
      seed - the seed
      octaves - the number of iterations
      lacunarity - the lacunarity
      gain - the gain
      deriv - the derivative
      Returns:
      the result

    • noise

      public static Vec2 noise​(Vec2 v, int seed, Vec2 target)
      Returns a value with the same number of dimensions as the input, 2. This is done by calling eval(float, float, int, Vec2) twice, with offset steps added to each component of the input vector.
      Parameters:
      v - the input vector
      seed - the seed
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the noise value

    • noise

      public static Vec2 noise​(Vec2 v, int seed, Vec2 target, Vec2 xDeriv, Vec2 yDeriv)
      Returns a value with the same number of dimensions as the input, 2. This is done by calling eval(float, float, int, Vec2) twice, with offset steps added to each component of the input vector. The derivatives are calculated for the output vectors.
      Parameters:
      v - the input vector
      seed - the seed
      target - the output vector
      xDeriv - the derivative for the x evaluation
      yDeriv - the derivative for the y evaluation
      Returns:
      the noise value
      See Also:
      Vec2.mag(Vec2), STEP_2, eval(float, float, int, Vec2)

    • noise

      public static Vec3 noise​(Vec3 v, int seed, Vec3 target)
      Returns a value with the same number of dimensions as the input, 3. This is done by calling eval(float, float, float, int, Vec3) thrice, with offset steps added to each component of the input vector.
      Parameters:
      v - the input vector
      seed - the seed
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the noise value

    • noise

      public static Vec3 noise​(Vec3 v, int seed, Vec3 target, Vec3 xDeriv, Vec3 yDeriv, Vec3 zDeriv)
      Returns a value with the same number of dimensions as the input, 3. This is done by calling eval(float, float, float, int, Vec3) thrice, with offset steps added to each component of the input vector. The derivatives are calculated for the output vectors.
      Parameters:
      v - the input vector
      seed - the seed
      target - the output vector
      xDeriv - the derivative for the x evaluation
      yDeriv - the derivative for the y evaluation
      zDeriv - the derivative for the z evaluation
      Returns:
      the noise value
      See Also:
      Vec3.mag(Vec3), STEP_3

    • noise

      public static Vec4 noise​(Vec4 v, int seed, Vec4 target)
      Returns a value with the same number of dimensions as the input, 4. This is done by calling eval(float, float, float, float, int) four times, with offset steps added to each component of the input vector.
      Parameters:
      v - the input vector
      seed - the seed
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the noise value

    • noise

      public static Vec4 noise​(Vec4 v, int seed, Vec4 target, Vec4 xDeriv, Vec4 yDeriv, Vec4 zDeriv, Vec4 wDeriv)
      Returns a value with the same number of dimensions as the input, 4. This is done by calling eval(float, float, float, float, int, Vec4) four times, with offset steps added to each component of the input vector. The derivatives are calculated for the output vectors.
      Parameters:
      v - the input vector
      seed - the seed
      target - the output vector
      xDeriv - the derivative for the x evaluation
      yDeriv - the derivative for the y evaluation
      zDeriv - the derivative for the z evaluation
      wDeriv - the derivative for the w evaluation
      Returns:
      the noise value
      See Also:
      Vec4.mag(Vec4), STEP_4, eval(float, float, float, float, int, Vec4)

    • voronoi

      public static float voronoi​(Vec2 coord, int seed, float scale, Vec2 target)
      Generates 2D Voronoi noise. Returns the minimum Euclidean distance; the Voronoi point is stored in an output vector.
      Parameters:
      coord - the coordinate
      seed - the seed
      scale - the scale
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the distance

    • voronoi

      public static float voronoi​(Vec4 coord, int seed, float scale, Vec4 target)
      Generates 4D voronoi noise. Returns the minimum Euclidean distance; the voronoi point is stored in an output vector.
      Parameters:
      coord - the coordinate
      seed - the seed
      scale - the scale
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the distance
